Description: Body sherd of large Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; traces of possible bands in added colour; exterior: rays between lines at bottom of wall; below, in handle zone, frill pattern near handle root on left; on right, start of guilloche pattern.
Curator's comments: The size of the piece will have been that of a chalice-krater.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 238, no. 183)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0122) (phase 2)
